application

Class GraphMaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.GraphMaster

  • public class GraphMaster
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0.0 Build 1 November 20, 2020.

    Program GraphMaster Description


    Usage :% java GraphMaster

    This program manipulates the stock market graph of the Market Madness application. This program implements a stock algorithm and formats a graph to display the information. It has a set number of "days" the game will run, and this program keeps track of the current day, when to move on to the next day, and when the last day of the stock game will be. It also shows the prices of the stocks for any given day.

    ALGORITHM:

    Create MapMap as a Hashmap containing a String, the stock name, and a secondary HashMap of Integers(Day value) and Integers(Stock Value)
    Create CurDay and endDay which are used to increment and display the current day value

    GameStart()
    Initializes the curDay and endDay value, as well as filling all three stock with ALL their values by calling masterGen
    The PlayerData is also called to initlize the players starting cash
    Initialize Player data with starting cash
    Add and Generate maps

    getCurDay()
    Returns the current day value
    ProgressDay()
    Cleans off the LineChart and proceeds to redraw all graphs one day in advance, giving the appearance that new data has been generated when in reality we are just showing more of each stocks already plotted graphs
    The method updates all UI elements with their current prices
    Will trigger the 'end of game' where all buttons are disabled other than 'RESULTS'
    IncrementDay value
    Style
    Clean Last Graph
    Add series
    Tabulate absolute total text
    Tabulate stock total text
    Tabulate total cash
    Tabulate and post amount of held stock
    Tabulate and post the value of your held stock
    Post All Market Values
    Change Days left
    Disable next button, End of game

    getEndDay()
    Calculates How many days are left

    Part()
    Returns up to a day of stock values as a XYChart Series

    masterGen()
    The formulation method for all values in the stock
    Takes in an int variance, an int, inital value and a cashMultiplier
    Returns a HashMap of Intergers (Day) and Intergers (stock value)
    The Size of the Map is set via the endDay integer
    Within the while loop there is a safeguard eliminates all zero values, as they would break the gameplay
    Each walk through the while loop randomly generates a calculatedVariance which has a chance to be negative or positive causing the stock to dive or rise
    Implement stock Algorithm

    curPrice()
    Returns the stock value at a given day
    Author:
    Paul O'Bar, Julian Negrete, Gideon Reyes, Tinesha Johnson, Stephen Otten

    • Method Detail

      • GameStart

        public static void GameStart()
        The GameStart method initializes the curDay and endDay value, as well as filling all three stock with ALL their values by calling masterGen. The PlayerData is also called to initlize the players starting cash.
        Parameters:
        curDay - the Integer value of the current day
        endDay - the Integer value of the days left
        MapMap - a Map that contains a Stock name, and a secondary HashMap that has the day value and the stock value, both Integers.
        See Also:
        masterGen();, PlayerData.initilizePlayerData();

      • getCurDay

        public static int getCurDay()
        getCurDay returns the current day value
        Returns:
        curDay Current day value

      • progressDay

        public static void progressDay(javafx.scene.chart.LineChart<?,?> LineChart,
                               java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javafx.scene.text.Text> uiMap,
                               java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javafx.scene.control.Button> buttonMap)
        ProgressDay Cleans off the LineChart and proceeds to redraw all graphs one day in advance, giving the appearance that new data has been generated when in reality we are just showing more of each stocks already plotted graphs. Along with this the method updates all UI elements with their current prices. Eventually this method will trigger the 'end of game' where all buttons are disabled other than 'RESULTS'.
        Parameters:
        LineChart - The Linechart to display the graph on
        uiMap - TextMap including all Text elements from GameController.java
        buttonMap - ButtonMap including all Button elements from GameController.java

      • getEndDay

        public static int getEndDay()
        Calculates How many days are left
        Returns:
        Days left (endDay - curDay)

      • Part

        public static javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series Part(java.lang.String stock,
                                                     int day)
        Part returns up to a day of stock values as a XYChart Series.
        Parameters:
        stock - Name of stock
        day - Current day value
        Returns:
        XYChart.Series X = Day value Y = Stock Value at Day

      • masterGen

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> masterGen(int variance,
                                                                               int inital,
                                                                               int cashMultiplier)
        masterGen is the formulation method for all values in the stock. It takes in an int variance, an int, inital value and a cashMultiplier. The method returns a HashMap of Intergers (Day) and Intergers (stock value). The Size of the Map is set via the endDay integer. Within the while loop there is a safeguard eliminates all zero values, as they would break the gameplay. Each walk through the while loop randomly generates a calculatedVariance which has a chance to be negative or positive causing the stock to dive or rise.
        Parameters:
        variance - an integer that determines the likely hood of the value of a stock to change day by day
        inital - an integer that sets the starting value of the stock
        cashMultiplier - an integer that multiplies the stocks value, ie making them more sporadic
        Returns:
        HashMap of Integers(Day) and Integers (Stock Value)

      • curPrice

        public static int curPrice(java.lang.String stock,
                           int day)
        curPrice returns the stock value at a given day.
        Parameters:
        stock - valid stock name
        day - valid day value
        Returns:
        current price of stock
